oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Land indenture and certificate for the selling of Oher kobbe's land to David Hubbard
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: This land indenture and certification of land appraisal details the transfer of land in Alabama from a Creek woman named Oher kobbe to David Hubbard. She received $360.00 from David Hubbard for her lands. On the back is the certification of the land deed, which states she sold about 120 acres to Hubbard and describes how many acres of land were good, fair or unfit for cultivation. The certification is signed by Certifying Agent Leonard Tarrant.

After the Creek Nation negotiated with the United States for cession of lands and removal west, many Creeks voluntarily moved before the Second Creek War and the forced removal by the U.S. military began in 1836.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Indian Removal, 1813-1903; Indians of North America--Relocation
Indigenous peoples
